2021-11-14T18:49:12Z: And that's all from us - we'll be back next weekend for the first Qatar Grand Prix! We'll see you then!
2021-11-14T18:48:16Z: Hope you've all got your breaths back after that one - here's the report for you: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/brazilian-f1-gp-race-report/6781932/
2021-11-14T18:37:32Z: Ocon and Alonso swapped places on the last lap for, uh, some reason.
2021-11-14T18:37:08Z: Leclerc leads Sainz home for a Ferrari 5-6, with Gasly beating Ocon, Alonso and Norris.
2021-11-14T18:36:45Z: Perez does indeed grab the fastest lap, a 1m11.010s. As binary as you like.
2021-11-14T18:36:20Z: Max Verstappen finishes in second, 10.4s behind, with Bottas completing the podium places.
2021-11-14T18:35:54Z: Starting from 10th, Lewis Hamilton wins the Sao Paulo Grand Prix!
2021-11-14T18:35:29Z: It's the final lap now, and Hamilton's doing his last tour in an absolutely stellar weekend - carving his way through the field in both races.
2021-11-14T18:34:00Z: Perez does indeed come in for his expected stop, taking on the softs.
2021-11-14T18:33:28Z: The gaps up and down the running order have well and truly spread out so barring any late dramas, that's your lot.
2021-11-14T18:32:24Z: Three to go - lead now at 7.7s.
2021-11-14T18:31:08Z: As of lap 68, Hamilton's built a 6.7s lead over Verstappen now. Bottas looks like he won't have the time to put Verstappen under pressure.
2021-11-14T18:30:35Z: Gasly has cleared off ahead of the Alpine pair, 4.4s in front of Alonso, so barring a hellish end to this race that is seventh place for the AlphaTauri driver behind the Ferraris.
2021-11-14T18:28:26Z: It's all calmed down a bit now, that Hamilton/Verstappen battle kinda consumed us for a bit.
2021-11-14T18:25:40Z: Hamilton's 3s clear of Verstappen now as of lap 64, showing the pace he's got in hand over the Red Bull.
2021-11-14T18:25:36Z: A lap later it is double delight for Gasly, with the aid of DRS and fresher tyres he charges by Alonso on the sprint down the back straight to Turn 4 and grabs seventh. Super racing.
2021-11-14T18:24:05Z: Gasly and Ocon go oh-so-close to contact at Turn 1, but the AlphaTauri driver gets the move done under braking to grab eighth. Both have DRS on the charge to Turn 4 but Gasly defends well to keep the place.
2021-11-14T18:22:28Z: Not to distract from the fight at the front, but there is an almighty tussle going on for seventh place. Alonso holds it, followed by Ocon and Gasly who both are in DRS range.
2021-11-14T18:22:19Z: Verstappen, meanwhile, gets a black-and-white flag for weaving on the straights.
2021-11-14T18:21:47Z: Hamilton make Verstappen stay to the inside of Turn 1, getting the overspeed on the exit of three and diving past the Red Bull driver!
2021-11-14T18:20:49Z: But Hamilton's right with him at the start of lap 59, and he clears Verstappen just before the two make it into Turn 4!
2021-11-14T18:20:01Z: Hamilton has another look at Verstappen at Turn 4, but just can't make the move work! A stout defence from the Red Bull once more.
2021-11-14T18:19:20Z: So after that off-track incident, Hamilton's staying in DRS range - he's got 14 laps to make a move here.
2021-11-14T18:18:04Z: Vettel pits for a second time in the race and drops to 11th to put Norris into the points.
2021-11-14T18:14:37Z: Couple of quick pitstops in the midfield shuffles things around. Gasly pits to drop to ninth place, as Leclerc also pits but with a big enough gap behind to retain sixth.
2021-11-14T18:13:58Z: Leclerc does his second stop, grabbing the hard tyre.
2021-11-14T18:13:24Z: The FIA says that no investigation is necessary.
2021-11-14T18:13:08Z: With Norris only 11th, it could be a big day for Ferrari in the fight for third place in the F1 constructors' standings with Sainz fifth and Leclerc sixth.
2021-11-14T18:11:22Z: It is turning into a race to forget for McLaren, as Ricciardo pits and retires from the race. He had been running in eighth place.
2021-11-14T18:09:55Z: Stroll has pulled into the Aston Martin pits and retired from the race. We'd suspect it is due to damage from his earlier clash with Tsunoda.
2021-11-14T18:08:38Z: The stewards will have a look at that Verstappen/Hamilton battle.
2021-11-14T18:08:03Z: Hamilton has a go at Verstappen into Turn 4, but both drivers end up off the road! Verstappen really forced him wide there.
2021-11-14T18:05:56Z: Hamilton's making no bones of cutting into Verstappen's lead, posting a 1m11.982s on the end of lap 46 and gets into DRS range.
2021-11-14T18:05:39Z: Stroll, on older tyres, loses two places in quick succession to Raikkonen and Norris. The Finn is up to 12th, Norris in 13th and Stroll is 14th.
2021-11-14T18:04:08Z: Perez, meanwhile, dispatches Leclerc who's yet to do his second stop.
2021-11-14T18:02:39Z: Hamilton now stops, grabbing the hard tyre, and comes out about 2.7s behind Verstappen.
2021-11-14T18:01:39Z: Verstappen drops a 1m12.959s on those fresh tyres.
2021-11-14T18:00:04Z: Tsunoda pits, serving his 10-second penalty from his clash with Stroll, to drop to 17th place only ahead of Latifi, Mazepin and Schumacher.
2021-11-14T17:59:49Z: Bottas is next to pit, hard tyres for the Finnish driver.
2021-11-14T17:58:55Z: Verstappen elects to stop in reaction to that, and takes the hard tyre - but Latifi goes out ahead of him, which will lose him a tiny bit of time.
2021-11-14T17:57:29Z: A combination of six F1 world titles overtake Tsunoda in one move. In a wounded AlphaTauri, Tsunoda is powerless to stop the DRS-aided Vettel and Alonso to pass him at Turn 1. Vettel is up to 10th and Alonso 11th.
2021-11-14T17:55:25Z: Having pitted at the end of the first lap, Norris makes his second pitstop to take on another set of fresh hards in a stop of 3.8s, and rejoins in 17th place behind Raikkonen.
2021-11-14T17:53:56Z: Double joy for Alpine as a lap later Ocon passes Tsunoda at the first corner to move up to 10th place.
2021-11-14T17:53:40Z: Hamilton's a bit stuck behind Verstappen at the moment, sitting around 1.2-1.4s behind as he's not quite able to draw closer.
2021-11-14T17:53:18Z: Alonso makes early amends by passing Russell to take 13th place.
2021-11-14T17:51:25Z: At the end of lap 34 Alonso pits from sixth place, taking on fresh hards in a slow-ish stop of 4s, to see the Spanish driver rejoin in 14th place.
2021-11-14T17:49:06Z: Leclerc moves up to fifth place by passing Alonso on the start/finish straight. The Alpine driver is yet to stop in this race so it wasn't a fair fight.
2021-11-14T17:48:56Z: Bottas posts a 1m13.002s to pick up the fastest lap, as Verstappen held it for a fleeting moment.
2021-11-14T17:47:59Z: Ricciardo has been waved by McLaren team-mate Norris to move up to ninth place and continue his chase of Gasly and the two Ferrari ahead of him.
2021-11-14T17:47:33Z: We're back under green-flag running, and although Hamilton sat 1.5s behind at the start of it, he's getting within DRS range of Verstappen now.
2021-11-14T17:46:05Z: Bottas takes the opportunity to stop under the VSC, collecting the hard tyre, so Mercedes found a nice, cost-effective way to get him ahead of Perez.
2021-11-14T17:45:23Z: Virtual Safety Car is called as Stroll's Aston Martin drops more debris from his early clash with Tsunoda.
2021-11-14T17:45:00Z: Hamilton's cut the gap down to 1.2s, doing a 1m13.162s to home in on his title rival.
2021-11-14T17:44:49Z: Gasly, on his fresher hard tyres, gets by Norris at Turn 1 to take 10th place.
2021-11-14T17:44:18Z: Perez also stopped on lap 28 for hard tyres, emerging 5s behind Ricciardo to come out fifth.
2021-11-14T17:43:55Z: Plenty of pitlane action as Leclerc, Vettel and Raikkonen all dive in for fresh tyres. The running order is chopping and changing, so we'll get back to you on it when it all shakes out.
2021-11-14T17:43:12Z: Regardless, it's a 1m13.364s for Hamilton, who sets our new fastest lap.
2021-11-14T17:42:38Z: Verstappen duly pits, reacting to Hamilton, and collects the hard tyre. Ricciardo ahead didn't help the Mercedes, but Hamilton's cut the gap down to Verstappen.
2021-11-14T17:41:21Z: A lap later Sainz pits, Ferrari reacting to AlphaTauri's stop for Gasly, to keep the Spanish driver ahead on track.
2021-11-14T17:41:06Z: Hamilton takes the initiative and calls in for fresh boots, taking on the hard tyre.
2021-11-14T17:39:38Z: Gasly is the latest to pit, ditching his mediums for a fresh set of hard tyres, to see the AlphaTauri driver rejoin the action in 15th place behind Raikkonen.
2021-11-14T17:36:16Z: On lap 23 Stroll pits, exposing damage he sustained in the clash with Tsunoda earlier, as he takes on hard tyres and comes out in 19th place.
2021-11-14T17:35:53Z: Hamilton isn't taking too much out of Verstappen at this point; the gap's down to about 3.6s as of lap 23.
2021-11-14T17:35:05Z: Further back Stroll was also got in front of Alonso for a handful of corners before the Alpine driver struck back to regain 11th. That battle lost Stroll a chink of time and has invited Giovinazzi on to his rear wing.
2021-11-14T17:34:04Z: Leclerc and Sainz are doing the usual Ferrari things, sitting in fifth and sixth relatively undisturbed. Gasly, unlike last weekend, is 2s behind them.
2021-11-14T17:33:51Z: And just like the Hamilton vs Perez battle, Ricciardo makes the move stick second time around at the first corner to take eighth place off Vettel.
2021-11-14T17:32:56Z: Ricciardo briefly gets by Vettel at Turn 1 until the German driver returns to favour at Turn 4. That battle isn't over yet though.
2021-11-14T17:31:49Z: Verstappen's 3.8s up the road in first, evidently not wishing to give Perez DRS after all. Hamilton will need to go and make that up to challenge for the lead.
2021-11-14T17:30:57Z: But Hamilton steams around the outside once again at the start of the 19th lap, and should have enough to ward Perez off into Turn 4. Bottas can now begin to battle Perez.
2021-11-14T17:30:00Z: No investigation needed for the Raikkonen vs Schumacher clash. That'll be one to compare to Tsunoda vs Stroll at the end of this race, given the Japanese driver got a heavy penalty for his clash.
2021-11-14T17:29:55Z: He can! Hamilton dives around the outside of Perez at the start of lap 18 from a fair way back and steams past the Red Bull - but Perez gets him back into Turn 4!
2021-11-14T17:28:58Z: Hamilton has a go at Perez at the start of lap 17, but he's not close enough. But he's tracking the Red Bull through the infield, can he do it this time?
2021-11-14T17:28:45Z: Norris is up to 14th having got ahead of Mazepin. That means he's caught up with the middle chunk of the midfield, with Giovinazzi two seconds ahead in 13th.
2021-11-14T17:27:13Z: The race stewards have noted the clash between Raikkonen and Schumacher which triggered the second spill of debris and the Virtual Safety Car period.
2021-11-14T17:26:00Z: Tsunoda has been given a 10-second penalty for causing a collision for his part in the clash with Stroll. That's double disaster for the AlphaTauri driver having lost his front wing in the crash.
2021-11-14T17:25:51Z: Perez put a little bit of space between himself and Hamilton here as the VSC came to an end. Hamilton, however, is still within DRS range.
2021-11-14T17:24:46Z: So now Schumacher is at the back of the field with his new front wing. It has been a messy first 14 laps of this race so far.
2021-11-14T17:24:33Z: The virtual safety car is now over - and we're back to full racing speed.
2021-11-14T17:23:15Z: Hamilton is stalking Perez, waiting for the VSC to be switched off so he can make further ground.
2021-11-14T17:22:03Z: Part of Schumacher's broken front wing comes off on the track as the Haas driver slowly makes his way to the pits for a new front wing.
2021-11-14T17:21:26Z: We've got a VSC for that Schumacher debris, which flew off in the infield section.
2021-11-14T17:20:57Z: Schumacher's dropped to the back of the pack and is dragging his front wing underneath his car. TV replays show he was side-by-side with Raikkonen and the pair made contact at Turn 1.
2021-11-14T17:20:31Z: Hamilton is in DRS range of Perez, but can't open the flap just yet - if he can keep the gap about the same, the Red Bull might be looking shaky here.
2021-11-14T17:19:04Z: Clean restart by the rest of the field, as Latifi loses places to Raikkonen, Norris and Tsunoda.
2021-11-14T17:19:03Z: Bottas is having to defend from Leclerc as the Ferrari seems to be very switched on at this restart.
2021-11-14T17:18:30Z: Full speed ahead! Verstappen really backed the pack up there into Turn 1 - but we're back up and running.
2021-11-14T17:16:59Z: Catching up on the movers and shakers after that early action, a small nod to Mazepin who is up to 14th place ahead of team-mate Schumacher and Latifi - with pitlane-starter Raikkonen P17 ahead of those who pitted early.
2021-11-14T17:16:33Z: The safety car will come in at the end of lap 9.
2021-11-14T17:14:08Z: Russell pits under the safety car, switching his mediums for hards, to drop to 18th place.
2021-11-14T17:12:58Z: Replays from Tsunoda's onboard show the Japanese driver, the only one to start on the softs, dived up the inside of Stroll at Turn 1 but got the door slammed in his face which meant the two came together at the apex. A bit messy.
2021-11-14T17:12:00Z: Lots of debris from the Tsunoda/Stroll incident, so the safety car's out and the marshals will do some clearance in Turn 1. Lots of AlphaTauri bits hanging around.
2021-11-14T17:10:42Z: Tsunoda has to pit at the end of lap three to get a new front wing to drop him down to 19th place.
2021-11-14T17:09:52Z: Bottas has allowed Hamilton past at the start of lap 5, which has lifted the #44 car up to third already. Next up? Perez. This is where it gets more difficult.
2021-11-14T17:09:47Z: Tsunoda and Stroll come together at the Senna Esses, with the AlphaTauri driver losing his front wing as a result. That's spilled debris around the outside of Turn 1 which could risk punctures for the rest of the field.
2021-11-14T17:08:30Z: Having pitted at the end of lap one, Norris is back in the action on hard tyres in 20th and last place. With Ricciardo only in 10th place, it is a disaster start for McLaren.
2021-11-14T17:08:28Z: Hamilton's on fire, having cleared Leclerc now and has set a 1m14.254s - the fastest lap so far.
2021-11-14T17:06:41Z: Hamilton's right in Sainz's slipstream, and kicks off lap 3 by diving past and claiming fifth!
2021-11-14T17:05:54Z: At the start of the second lap Hamilton gets another move done overtaking Vettel at the first turn. The Mercedes driver is now sixth hunting down the two Ferraris.
2021-11-14T17:05:38Z: Bottas goes off into Turn 4 on lap 1 too, and that gives us a Red Bull 1-2! Bottas is third, with Leclerc and Sainz behind him.
2021-11-14T17:04:44Z: Hamilton keeps clear of the first corner danger and then goes around the outside of Gasly at Turn 7 to move up to seventh place.
2021-11-14T17:04:26Z: Verstappen clears Bottas into the first corner, as Norris finds himself off the road with a puncture at Turn 1!
2021-11-14T17:03:39Z: The 2021 Brazilian Grand Prix is go!
2021-11-14T17:02:23Z: The field circulates and pulls into their grid slots...it's almost time.
2021-11-14T17:00:09Z: With the warm conditions and middle trio of tyres, hopefully we'll get a bit of strategic variation today. That'd be just lovely.
2021-11-14T16:57:52Z: Tyre news: we've got the full field starting on mediums today, apart from Tsunoda on softs.
2021-11-14T16:54:43Z: Risk of rain, like yesterday, is zero percent. Shame, a bit of rain usually goes nicely here...
2021-11-14T16:52:19Z: Positioning into Turn 1 is going to be crucial - do you want the inside or the outside?
2021-11-14T16:51:28Z: Just about 10 minutes until we get going here - the excitement is bubbling away quite nicely.
2021-11-14T16:45:30Z: Yesterday's sprint race was made rather exciting by Hamilton's charge through the order. With hotter temperatures and high fuel, it might be a bit harder to pull off.
2021-11-14T16:42:27Z: Lots of fallout from the Hamilton qualifying disqualification - but today, we race. Well, the drivers race, we sit here and blather on about it. Who's really got the tougher job?
2021-11-14T16:41:33Z: It's very warm in Brazil, 23 degrees C air temperature, but a big ol' 55 degrees C on-track. Degradation will be rather high.
2021-11-14T16:38:49Z: Hello everyone, and welcome to our live blog for the Brazilian Grand Prix! Just over 20 minutes until it's lights out at Interlagos...
